TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ManifestSignatureInformation extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides information for a manifest signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformation.VerifySignature%2A> method to obtain a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformationCollection> object that can be use to examine the signature information.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AuthenticodeSignature As AuthenticodeSignatureInformation

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the Authenticode signature information for a manifest.
Docs.value: An object that contains Authenticode signature information for the manifest, or if there is no signature.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Manifest As ManifestKinds
public: property System::Security::ManifestKinds Manifest { System::Security::ManifestKinds get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the type of a manifest.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property StrongNameSignature As StrongNameSignatureInformation

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the details of the strong name signature of a manifest.
Docs.value: A object that contains the signature, or if there is no strong name signature.

Docs.summary: Gathers and verifies information about the signatures of the specified manifests.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformationCollection VerifySignature(class System.ActivationContext application) cil managed
Public Shared Function VerifySignature (application As ActivationContext) As ManifestSignatureInformationCollection

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The activation context of the manifest. Activation contexts belong to an application and contain multiple manifests.
Docs.summary: Gathers and verifies information about the signatures of manifests that belong to a specified activation context.
Docs.returns: A collection that contains a object for each manifest that is verified.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The activation context of the manifest. Activation contexts belong to an application and contain multiple manifests.
The type of manifest. This parameter specifies which manifests in the activation context you want to verify.
Docs.summary: Gathers and verifies information about the signatures of manifests that belong to a specified activation context and manifest type.
Docs.returns: A collection that contains a object for each manifest that is verified.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformationCollection VerifySignature (ActivationContext application, System.Security.ManifestKinds manifests, System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationFlag revocationFlag, System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode revocationMode);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.ManifestSignatureInformationCollection VerifySignature(class System.ActivationContext application, valuetype System.Security.ManifestKinds manifests, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationFlag revocationFlag, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode revocationMode) cil managed

Public Shared Function VerifySignature (application As ActivationContext, manifests As ManifestKinds, revocationFlag As X509RevocationFlag, revocationMode As X509RevocationMode) As ManifestSignatureInformationCollection

public: static System::Security::Cryptography::ManifestSignatureInformationCollection ^ VerifySignature(ActivationContext ^ application, System::Security::ManifestKinds manifests, System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509RevocationFlag revocationFlag, System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509RevocationMode revocationMode);

Docs.param: The application context of the manifests. Activation contexts belong to an application and contain multiple manifests.
The type of manifest. This parameter specifies which manifests in the activation context you want to verify.
One of the enumeration values that specifies which certificates in the chain are checked for revocation. The default is .
Determines whether the X.509 verification should look online for revocation lists.
Docs.summary: Gathers and verifies information about the signatures of manifests that belong to a specified activation context and manifest type, and allows certificates to be selected for revocation.
Docs.returns: A collection that contains a object for each manifest that is verified.
Docs.exception: A value specified for the or parameter is invalid.
